thread.title: Was there a ‘third force’ in protests?
thread.title_full: Was there a ‘third force’ in protests? | News24

author: news24.com
title: Was there a ‘third force’ in protests?
text:
The iconic statue of Nelson Mandela at the Union Buildings disappeared behind clouds of smoke as chaos erupted beneath his feet. A police helicopter hovered above as running battles ensued between police and protesters.
As the numbers swelled, panicked police inside the joint operations centre called in reinforcements from surrounding police stations as far as Hercules, Pretoria North, Wierdabrug, Atteridgeville and Laudium. At 10am, even non-operational officers, including spokespeople at the various stations, were called in to lend a hand.
A police officer inside the centre and another close to acting police commissioner Lieutenant General Khomotso Phahlane said police received information in the morning that members of the SA Students’ Congress were distributing T-shirts throughout the city early on Friday morning.
“Some of the drug addicts and criminals took the shirts and also joined the march,” said one of the officers. “There were also unruly protesters who incited violence.”
